item.title: Nordic aliens
item.description:
Alleged humanoid extraterrestrials ðŸ”—

In ufology, “Nordics,” “Nordic aliens,” or “Tall Whites” are names given to humanoid races from the Pleiades star cluster (Pleiadians) who resemble “Nordic,” Germanic, or Scandinavian humans. Contactees describe them as taller than average humans (6-7 ft), with “European” features like blond hair, blue eyes, and fair skin, sometimes with pale-blue/grey or pastel purple skin tones.

History ðŸ”—

Cultural historian David J. Skal suggests that early Nordic alien stories were inspired by the 1951 film The Day the Earth Stood Still. Bates College professor Stephanie Kelley-Romano describes alien abduction beliefs as “a living myth,” associating Nordic aliens with spiritual growth and protection. In ufology, they are benevolent beings concerned about Earth’s ecology and world peace, possessing telepathic powers and described as paternal, watchful, smiling, affectionate, and youthful. While common in 1950s contactee claims, especially in Europe, Nordic alien encounters became less frequent as grey aliens became more prominent.

Publications by those claiming to have been contacted ðŸ”—

Several books detail alleged personal contact with Nordic aliens. These include Flying Saucers Have Landed and Inside the Space Ships by George Adamski, From Outer Space to You by Howard Menger, The Walton Experience by Travis Walton, and Millennial Hospitality by Charles James Hall (adapted into the film Walking with the Tall Whites). The UFO religion Universe People publishes “Talks with Teachings from my Cosmic Friends” detailing interactions with extraterrestrials.
